General.text:
Type: Penicillinase-resistant
penicillin
Dosage Forms: 250,500
Common Trade Names:

Skin_infections,_staphylococcal.text: 125-500mg PO q6h (1h before or 2h after meals)

Osteomyelitis.text: 250-500mg PO q6h (1h before or 2h after meals)

Skin_infections,_staphylococcal_2.text:
<40 kg: 12.5-25mg/kg/day PO divided q6h
>40kg: 125-500mg PO q6h

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy risk
: B (no evidence of risk)
Lactation: safety unknown
Renal Dosing
Adult: no adjustment
Pediatric: no adjustment
Hepatic Dosing
Adult: not defined
Pediatric: not defined

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
caution in asthma
caution in seizure disorder
caution in renal impairment

Serious.text:
anaphylaxis
serum sickness-like reaction
superinfection
C-diff
hemolytic anemia
leukopenia
agranulocytosis
neutropenia
thrombocytopenia
esophagitis
esophageal ulcer

Common.text:
nausea/vomiting
diarrhea
epigastric pain
urticaria
pruritus
fever
rash
eosinophilia
stomatitis
black hairy tongue
LFTs elevated

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 0.7h, if GFR < 10 then 1.8h
Metabolism:  liver partially
Excretion: urine 50-70% (primarily unchanged), bile 10%
Mechanism of Action: inhibits cell wall mucopeptide synthesis
